00325     bool samedim( const ArrayBase& v ) const
00326     {
00327         if( nd == v.nd && ne == v.ne )
00328                 {
00329             unsigned i;
00330             for( i = 0; i < nd && d[ i ] == v.d[ i ]; i++ );
00331             return i == nd;
00332         }
00333         return false;
00334     }

01022 template< class T >
01023 class Array : public ArrayBase
01024 {
01025   friend class ArrayReference< T >;
01026   friend class ArrayIndex;

01028   public:
01029 
01032     typedef T* iterator;

01039    //=======================================================================
01056     Array( )
01057     { 
01058         ne = 0;
01059         e = eEnd = 0;
01060     }
01061 
01062 
01063    //=======================================================================
01083     explicit Array( unsigned i )
01084     {
01085         d      = new unsigned[ 1 ];
01086         d[ 0 ] = i;
01087         nd     = 1;
01088         ne     = i;
01089         e      = 0;
01090         if( ne )
01091         {
01092             e = new T[ ne ];
01093         }
01094         stat = false;
01095         eEnd = e + ne;
01096     }
01097 
01098    //=======================================================================
01119     Array( unsigned i, unsigned j )
01120     {
01121         d      = new unsigned[ 2 ];
01122         d[ 0 ] = i;
01123         d[ 1 ] = j;
01124         nd     = 2;
01125         ne     = i * j;
01126         e      = 0;
01127         if( ne ) e = new T[ ne ];
01128         stat = false;
01129         eEnd = e + ne;
01130     }
01131 
01132    //=======================================================================
01154     Array( unsigned i, unsigned j, unsigned k )
01155     {
01156         d      = new unsigned[ 3 ];
01157         d[ 0 ] = i;
01158         d[ 1 ] = j;
01159         d[ 2 ] = k;
01160         nd     = 3;
01161         ne     = i * j * k;
01162         e      = 0;
01163         if( ne )
01164                 {
01165                         e = new T[ ne ];
01166                 }
01167                 stat = false;
01168         eEnd = e + ne;
01169     }
01170 
01171    //=======================================================================
01189     Array( std::vector< T >& v )
01190     {
01191         d      = new unsigned[ 1 ];
01192         d[ 0 ] = v.size( );
01193         nd     = 1;
01194         ne     = v.size( );
01195         e      = 0;
01196         if( ne )
01197                 {
01198             e = new T[ ne ];
01199             for( unsigned i = ne; i--; e[ i ] = v[ i ] );
01200         }
01201                 stat = false;
01202         eEnd = e + ne;
01203     }
01204 
01205    //=======================================================================
01226     Array( Array< T >& v, bool )
01227     {
01228         d      = v.d;
01229         e      = v.e;
01230         nd     = v.nd;
01231         ne     = v.ne;
01232         stat   = v.stat;
01233         v.nd   = v.ne = 0;
01234         v.stat = true;
01235         eEnd   = e + ne;
01236     }
01237 
01238    //=======================================================================
01257     Array( const Array< T >& v ) : ArrayBase( v )
01258     {
01259         if( ne )
01260         {
01261             e = new T[ ne ];
01262             for ( unsigned i = ne; i--; e[ i ] = v.e[ i ] );
01263             eEnd = e + ne;
01264         } else {
01265             e = eEnd = 0;
01266         }
01267     }
01268

01290     ~Array( )

01293         {
01294             if( ne )
01295             {
01296                 delete[ ] e;
01297             }
01298         }
01299     }

01523         RANGE_CHECK( j < d[ 1 ] )
01524         RANGE_CHECK( k < d[ 2 ] )
01525         return e[ d[ 2 ] * d[ 1 ] * i + d[ 2 ] * j + k ];

01561         RANGE_CHECK( k < d[ 2 ] )
01562         return e[ d[ 2 ] * d[ 1 ] * i + d[ 2 ] * j + k ];

01565 
01566    //=======================================================================
01591     T& operator ( ) ( const std::vector< unsigned >& i )
01592     {
01593         unsigned l, m, n;
01594         SIZE_CHECK( i.size( ) == nd )
01595 #ifndef NDEBUG
01596         for( l = nd; l--; )
01597           { RANGE_CHECK( i[ l ] < d[ l ] ) }
01598 #endif
01599         for( l = nd, m = 0, n = 1; l--; )
01600                 {
01601             m += i[ l ] * n;
01602             n *= d[ l ];
01603         }
01604 
01605         return e[ m ];
01606     }
01607

01641 #endif

01644             m += i[ l ] * n;

01718    //========================================================================
01742     Array< T >& operator = ( const Array< T >& v )
01743     {
01744         //
01745         // handle the special case of assigning an empty array
01746         // in order to avoid uninitialized memory read (purify)
01747         //
01748         if( v.nd )
01749         {
01750             resize_i( v.d, v.nd, false );
01751             for( unsigned i = ne; i--; e[ i ] = v.e[ i ] );
01752         }
01753         else
01754         {
01755             if( nd )
01756             {
01757                 delete[ ] d;
01758             }
01759             if( ne )
01760             {
01761                 delete[ ] e;
01762             }
01763             nd = ne = 0;
01764         }
01765 
01766         return *this;
01767     }

01898     Array< T >& append_elem( const T& w )
01899     {
01900         SIZE_CHECK( nd == 0 || nd == 1 )
01901 
01902         resize( ne + 1, true );
01903         e[ ne - 1 ] = w;
01904         return *this;
01905     }

01908    //========================================================================
01936     Array< T >& append_elems( const Array< T >& w )
01937     {
01938         SIZE_CHECK( ( nd == 0 || nd == 1 ) && w.nd == 1 )
01939 
01940         unsigned i = 0, j = ne;
01941 
01942         resize( ne + w.ne, true );
01943 
01944         while( i < w.ne )
01945                 {
01946             e[ j++ ] = w.e[ i++ ];
01947                 }
01948 
01949         return *this;
01950     }

01954    //========================================================================
02004     Array< T >& append_rows( const Array< T >& y )
02005     {
02006         SIZE_CHECK( ndim( ) == 0         ||
02007                     ndim( ) == y.ndim( ) ||
02008                     ndim( ) == y.ndim( ) + 1 )
02009 
02010         unsigned i, pos = nelem( );
02011         Array< unsigned > da;
02012 
02013         // Append rows to empty array:
02014         if( ndim( ) == 0 )
02015         {
02016             da.resize( y.ndim( ) + 1 );
02017             da( 0 ) = 1;
02018             for( i = 0; i < y.ndim( ); ++i )
02019             {
02020                 da( i + 1 ) = y.dim( i );
02021             }
02022         }
02023         else if( ndim( ) == y.ndim( ) )
02024         {
02025             da = dimarr( );
02026             da( 0 ) = dim( 0 ) + y.dim( 0 );
02027         }
02028         else if( ndim( ) == y.ndim( ) + 1 )
02029         {
02030             da = dimarr( );
02031             da( 0 )++;
02032         }
02033         else
02034         {
02035             return *this;
02036         }
02037 
02038         resize_i( da.elemvec( ), da.nelem( ), true );
02039         for( i = 0; i < y.nelem( ); )
02040         {
02041             elem( pos++ ) = y.elem( i++ );
02042         }
02043 
02044         return *this;
02045     }
02046

02050    //========================================================================
02077     Array< T >& remove_row( unsigned i )
02078     {
02079         RANGE_CHECK( ndim( ) > 0 && i < dim( 0 ) )
02080 
02081         unsigned k;
02082         unsigned size = nelem( ) / dim( 0 );
02083 
02084         Array< T        > y;
02085         Array< unsigned > da( dimarr( ) );
02086 
02087         da( 0 )--;
02088 
02089         y.resize_i( da.elemvec( ), da.nelem( ), false );
02090 
02091         for( k = 0; k < i * size; ++k )
02092                 {
02093             y.elem( k ) = elem( k );
02094                 }
02095         for( ; k < y.nelem( ); ++k )
02096                 {
02097             y.elem( k ) = elem( k + size );
02098                 }
02099 
02100         return *this = y;
02101     }

02106    //========================================================================
02132     Array< T > remove_col( unsigned k ) const
02133     {
02134         RANGE_CHECK( ndim( ) > 0 && k < dim( ndim( ) - 1 ) )
02135 
02136         unsigned i, j, xi, zi;
02137         unsigned xlast = dim  ( ndim  ( ) - 1 );
02138         unsigned num   = nelem( ) / xlast;
02139         Array< T > z;
02140         Array< unsigned > da( dimarr( ) );
02141 
02142         da( ndim( ) - 1 ) = xlast - 1;
02143 
02144         z.resize_i( da.elemvec( ), da.nelem( ), false );
02145 
02146         for( xi = zi = i = 0; i < num; ++i )
02147                 {
02148             for( j = 0; j < k; ++j )
02149                         {
02150                 z.elem( zi++ ) = elem( xi++ );
02151                         }
02152             for( ++xi, ++j; j < xlast; ++j )
02153                         {
02154                 z.elem( zi++ ) = elem( xi++ );
02155                         }
02156         }
02157 
02158         return Array< T >( z, true );
02159     }
02160

02163     
02164    //========================================================================
02193     Array< T > remove_cols( const Array< unsigned > idx ) const
02194     {
02195         RANGE_CHECK( ndim( ) > 0 && idx.ndim( ) == 1 )
02196 
02197         unsigned i, j, k, l, ni, xi, zi;
02198         unsigned xlast = dim  ( ndim  ( ) - 1 );
02199         unsigned num   = nelem( ) / xlast;
02200         Array< T > z;
02201         Array< unsigned > ix( idx );
02202         Array< unsigned > da( dimarr( ) );
02203 
02204         if( idx.nelem( ) == 0 )
02205                 {
02206             return *this;
02207                 }
02208 
02209         for( ni = 1, i = 0; i < ix.nelem( ) - 1; ++i )
02210                 {
02211             l = ix( k = i );
02212             for( j = i + 1; j < ix.nelem( ); ++j )
02213                         {
02214                 if( ix( j ) < l )
02215                                 {
02216                     l = ix( k = j );
02217                                 }
02218                         }
02219             if( k != i )
02220                         {
02221                 ix( k ) = ix( i );
02222                 ix( i ) = l;
02223             }
02224             if( ix( i ) != ix( i + 1 ) )
02225                         {
02226                 ++ni;
02227                         }
02228         }
02229         RANGE_CHECK( ix( ix.nelem( ) - 1 ) < dim( ndim( ) - 1 ) )
02230 
02231         da( ndim( ) - 1 ) = xlast - ni;
02232 
02233         z.resize_i( da.elemvec( ), da.nelem( ), false );
02234 
02235         for( xi = zi = i = 0; i < num; ++i )
02236                 {
02237             for( k = j = 0; k < ix.nelem( ); )
02238                         {
02239                 for( ; j < ix( k ); ++j )
02240                                 {
02241                     z.elem( zi++ ) = elem( xi++ );
02242                                 }
02243                 ++xi;
02244                 ++j;
02245                 do
02246                                 {
02247                     ++k;
02248                                 }
02249                 while( k < ix.nelem( ) && ix( k ) == ix( k - 1 ) );
02250             }
02251             for( ; j < xlast; ++j )
02252                         {
02253                 z.elem( zi++ ) = elem( xi++ );
02254                         }
02255         }
02256 
02257         return Array< T >( z, true );
02258     }

02446    //========================================================================
02481     Array< T > remove_cols( unsigned i, unsigned j, unsigned k,
02482                             unsigned l, unsigned m, unsigned n ) const
02483     {
02484         Array< unsigned > idx( 6 );
02485 
02486         idx( 0 ) = i;
02487         idx( 1 ) = j;
02488         idx( 2 ) = k;

02491         idx( 5 ) = n;
02492 
02493         return remove_cols( idx );
02494     }
02495 
02496     
02497     
02498    //========================================================================
02534     Array< T > remove_cols( unsigned i, unsigned j, unsigned k,
02535                             unsigned l, unsigned m, unsigned n,
02536                             unsigned o ) const
02537     {
02538         Array< unsigned > idx( 7 );
02539 
02540         idx( 0 ) = i;
02541         idx( 1 ) = j;
02542         idx( 2 ) = k;
02543         idx( 3 ) = l;
02544         idx( 4 ) = m;
02545         idx( 5 ) = n;
02546         idx( 6 ) = o;
02547 
02548         return remove_cols( idx );
02549     }
02550 
02551     
02552     
02553    //========================================================================
02590     Array< T > remove_cols( unsigned i, unsigned j, unsigned k,
02591                             unsigned l, unsigned m, unsigned n,
02592                             unsigned o, unsigned p ) const
02593     {
02594         Array< unsigned > idx( 8 );
02595 
02596         idx( 0 ) = i;
02597         idx( 1 ) = j;
02598         idx( 2 ) = k;
02599         idx( 3 ) = l;
02600         idx( 4 ) = m;
02601         idx( 5 ) = n;
02602         idx( 6 ) = o;
02603         idx( 7 ) = p;
02604 
02605         return remove_cols( idx );
02606     }
02607     
02608     
02609    //========================================================================
02663     Array< T > append_cols( const Array< T >& y ) const
02664     {
02665         SIZE_CHECK( ndim( ) == 0 || ndim( ) == y.ndim( ) )
02666 
02667         if( ndim( ) == 0 )
02668                 {
02669             return y;
02670                 }
02671         else
02672                 {
02673             unsigned i, j, xi, yi, zi;
02674             unsigned xlast = dim  ( ndim  ( ) - 1 );
02675             unsigned ylast = y.dim( y.ndim( ) - 1 );
02676             unsigned num;
02677             Array< T > z;
02678             Array< unsigned > da( dimarr( ) );
02679 
02680             da( ndim( ) - 1 ) = xlast + ylast;
02681 
02682             z.resize_i( da.elemvec( ), da.nelem( ), false );
02683 
02684             num = z.nelem( ) / ( xlast + ylast );
02685             for( i = xi = yi = zi = 0; i < num; ++i )
02686                         {
02687                 for( j = 0; j < xlast; ++j )
02688                                 {
02689                     z.elem( zi++ ) = elem( xi++ );
02690                                 }
02691                 for( j = 0; j < ylast; ++j )
02692                                 {
02693                     z.elem( zi++ ) = y.elem( yi++ );
02694                                 }
02695             }
02696 
02697             return Array< T >( z, true );
02698         }
02699     }
02700 
02701 
02702     
02703     
02704    //========================================================================
02760     Array< T > subarr( unsigned from, unsigned to ) const
02761     {
02762         SIZE_CHECK( ndim( ) > 0 )
02763         RANGE_CHECK( from <= to && from < dim( 0 ) && to < dim( 0 ) )
02764 
02765         unsigned i, j;
02766         unsigned fromi = from   * nelem( ) / dim( 0 );
02767         unsigned toi   = (to+1) * nelem( ) / dim( 0 );
02768         Array< T > z;
02769         Array< unsigned > da( dimarr( ) );
02770 
02771         da( 0 ) = to - from + 1;
02772 
02773         z.resize_i( da.elemvec( ), da.nelem( ), false );
02774 
02775         for( i = fromi, j = 0; i < toi; z.elem( j++ ) = elem( i++ ) );
02776 
02777         return Array< T >( z, true );
02778     }
02779 
02780 
02781     
02782     
02783    //========================================================================
02817     Array< unsigned > pos2idx( unsigned p )
02818     {
02819         RANGE_CHECK( p < ne )
02820 
02821         Array< unsigned > idx( ndim( ) );
02822         for( unsigned i = 0, j = nelem( ); i < ndim( ); ++i )
02823                 {
02824             p %= j;
02825             j /= dim( i );
02826             idx( i ) = p / j;
02827         }
02828         return idx;
02829     }
02830 
02831     
02832     
02833    //========================================================================
02866     void pos2idx( unsigned p, Array<unsigned>& idx)
02867     {
02868         RANGE_CHECK( p < ne )
02869                                 
02870         idx.resize( ndim( ) );
02871         for( unsigned i = 0, j = nelem( ); i < ndim( ); ++i )
02872         {
02873             p %= j;
02874             j /= dim( i );
02875             idx( i ) = p / j;
02876         }
02877     }
02878 
02879 
02880    //========================================================================
02905     Array< T > row( unsigned i ) const
02906     {
02907         return ( *this )[ i ];
02908     }
02909 
02910 
02911    //========================================================================
02939     Array< T > rows( const Array< unsigned >& idx ) const
02940     {
02941         SIZE_CHECK( ndim( ) > 0 )
02942         SIZE_CHECK( idx.ndim( ) <= 1 )
02943 
02944         unsigned i, j, k, l;
02945         unsigned n = nelem( ) / dim( 0 );
02946         Array< T > z;
02947         Array< unsigned > da( dimarr( ) );
02948 
02949         da( 0 ) = idx.nelem( );
02950         z.resize_i( da.elemvec( ), da.nelem( ), false );
02951 
02952         for( k = i = 0; i < idx.nelem( ); ++i )
02953                 {
02954             for( l = idx( i ) * n, j = 0; j < n; ++j )
02955                         {
02956                 z.elem( k++ ) = elem( l++ );
02957                         }
02958                 }
02959 
02960         return Array< T >( z, true );
02961     }
02962

02997 
02998         idx( 0 ) = i;
02999 
03000         return rows( idx );
03001     }

03387     
03388    //========================================================================
03413     Array< T > col( unsigned i ) const
03414     {
03415         SIZE_CHECK( ndim( ) > 0 )
03416         RANGE_CHECK( i < dim( ndim( ) - 1 ) )
03417 
03418         Array< T > z;
03419         Array< unsigned > da( dimarr( ) );
03420 
03421         z.resize_i( da.elemvec( ), da.nelem( ) - 1, false );
03422         for( unsigned k = 0; k < z.nelem( ); ++k, i += dim( ndim( ) - 1 ) )
03423                 {
03424             z.elem( k ) = elem( i );
03425                 }
03426 
03427         return z;
03428     }
03429 
03430     
03431     
03432    //========================================================================
03459     Array< T > cols( const Array< unsigned >& idx ) const
03460     {
03461         SIZE_CHECK( ndim( ) > 0 )
03462         SIZE_CHECK( idx.ndim( ) == 1 )
03463 
03464         unsigned j, k, m;
03465         unsigned l = dim( ndim( ) - 1 );
03466         unsigned n = nelem( ) / l;
03467         Array< T > z;
03468         Array< unsigned > ix( idx );
03469         Array< unsigned > da( dimarr( ) );
03470 
03471         da( ndim( ) - 1 ) = ix.nelem( );
03472         z.resize_i( da.elemvec( ), da.nelem( ), false );
03473 
03474         for( k = m = 0; k < n; ++k )
03475                 {
03476             for( j = 0; j < ix.nelem( ); ++j, ++m )
03477                         {
03478                 z.elem( m ) = elem( ix( j ) );
03479                 ix( j ) += l;
03480             }
03481                 }
03482 
03483         return z;
03484     }
03485 
03486     
03487

03517     {
03518         Array< unsigned > idx( 1 );
03519 
03520         idx( 0 ) = i;
03521 
03522         return cols( idx );
03523     }

03897     
03898 
03899    //========================================================================
03939     Array< T >& transpose( )
03940     {
03941         unsigned i, j, k;
03942 
03943         switch( ndim( ) )
03944                 {
03945             case 0 :
03946             case 1 :
03947                 break;
03948             case 2 :
03949                 for( i = 0; i < dim( 0 ); ++i )
03950                                 {
03951                     for( j = 0; j < i; ++j )
03952                                         {
03953                         std::swap( ( *this )( i, j ), ( *this )( j, i ) );
03954                                         }
03955                                 }
03956                 break;
03957             default :
03958                 unsigned size = nelem( ) / ( dim( 0 ) * dim( 1 ) );
03959                 for( i = 0; i < dim( 0 ); ++i )
03960                                 {
03961                     for( j = 0; j < i; ++j )
03962                                         {
03963                         unsigned m = i * dim( 1 ) + j;
03964                         unsigned n = j * dim( 1 ) + i;
03965                         for( k = 0; k < size; ++k )
03966                                                 {
03967                             std::swap( elem( m++ ), elem( n++ ) );
03968                                                 }
03969                     }
03970                                 }
03971                 break;
03972         }
03973 
03974         return *this;
03975     }
03976 
03977 
03978    //========================================================================
04021     Array< T > rotate_rows( int n ) const
04022     {
04023         SIZE_CHECK( ndim( ) > 0 )
04024 
04025         unsigned i;
04026         int l;
04027         Array< T > newx;
04028         switch( ndim( ) )
04029                 {
04030             case 0 :
04031                 break;
04032             case 1 :
04033                 newx.resize( nelem( ) );
04034                 for( i = 0; i < nelem( ); ++i )
04035                                 {
04036                     l = i + n;
04037                     if( l < 0 )
04038                                         {
04039                         l += nelem( );
04040                                         }
04041                     if( l >= nelem( ) )
04042                                         {
04043                         l -= nelem( );
04044                                         }
04045                     newx( l ) = elem( i );
04046                 }
04047                 break;
04048             default :
04049                 newx.resize( *this );
04050                 for( i = 0; i < dim( 0 ); ++i )
04051                                 {
04052                     l = i + n;
04053                     if( l < 0 )
04054                                         {
04055                         l += dim( 0 );
04056                                         }
04057                     if( l >= dim( 0 ) )
04058                                         {
04059                         l -= dim( 0 );
04060                                         }
04061                     newx[ l ] = ( *this )[ i ];
04062                 }
04063         }
04064 
04065         return Array< T >( newx, true );
04066     }
04067 
04068 
04069    //========================================================================
04112     Array< T > rotate_cols( int n )
04113     {
04114         SIZE_CHECK( ndim( ) > 0 )
04115 
04116         unsigned i, j;
04117         unsigned xlast;
04118         unsigned num;
04119         int l;
04120         Array< T > newx;
04121         switch( ndim( ) )
04122                 {
04123             case 0 :
04124                 break;
04125             case 1 :
04126                 newx.resize( nelem( ) );
04127                 for( i = 0; i < nelem( ); ++i )
04128                                 {
04129                     l = i + n;
04130                     if( l < 0 )
04131                                         {
04132                         l += nelem( );
04133                                         }
04134                     if( l >= nelem( ) )
04135                                         {
04136                         l -= nelem( );
04137                                         }
04138                     newx( l ) = elem( i );
04139                 }
04140                 break;
04141             default :
04142                 newx.resize( *this );
04143                 xlast = dim( ndim( ) - 1 );
04144                 num = nelem( ) / xlast;
04145                 for( i = 0; i < num; ++i )
04146                                 {
04147                     for( j = 0; j < xlast; ++j )
04148                                         {
04149                         l = j + n;
04150                         if( l < 0 )
04151                                                 {
04152                             l += dim( 0 );
04153                                                 }
04154                         if( l >= dim( 0 ) )
04155                                                 {
04156                             l -= dim( 0 );
04157                                                 }
04158                         newx.elem( i * xlast + l ) = elem( i * xlast + j );
04159                     }
04160                                 }
04161         }
04162 
04163         return Array< T >( newx, true );
04164     }
04165 
04166     
04167     
04168     
04169    //========================================================================
04188     Array< unsigned > dimarr( ) const
04189     {
04190         Array< unsigned > dim( nd );
04191         for( unsigned i = nd; i--; dim( i ) = d[ i ] );
04192         return dim;
04193     }
04194

04197    //========================================================================
04218     ArrayBase* clone( ) const { return new Array< T >( *this ); }
04219 
04220 
04221    //========================================================================
04243     ArrayBase* empty( ) const { return new Array< T >( );       }
04244

04247     bool operator == ( const Array< T >& ) const
04248     {
04249         return false;
04250     }
04251 
04253     bool operator != ( const Array< T >& ) const
04254     {
04255         return false;
04256     }
04257 
04259     bool operator < ( const Array< T >& ) const
04260     {
04261         return false;
04262     }
04263 
04265     bool operator > ( const Array< T >& ) const
04266     {
04267         return false;
04268     }
04269 #endif

04272    //=======================================================================
04293     inline iterator begin( )
04294     {
04295         return e;
04296     }
04297 
04298 
04299    //=======================================================================
04320     inline const const_iterator begin( ) const
04321     {
04322         return e;
04323     }
04324 
04325    //=======================================================================
04346     inline iterator end( )
04347     {
04348         return eEnd;
04349     }
04350                 
04351    //=======================================================================
04372     inline const const_iterator end()   const
04373     {
04374         return eEnd;
04375     }
04376 
04377   protected:
04378     
04379    //=======================================================================
04451     T*        e;
04452 
04454     T*        eEnd; 
04455 
04456     
04457    //=======================================================================
04501     void resize_i( unsigned* _d, unsigned _nd, bool copy )
04502     {
04503         unsigned j, _ne;
04504 
04505         // Adopt dimension vector if necessary:
04506         if( nd != _nd )
04507         {
04508             // Can only resize non-static arrays:
04509             SIZE_CHECK( ! stat )
04510 
04511             // Delete dimension vector if present:
04512             if( nd )
04513             {
04514                 delete[ ] d;
04515             }
04516 
04517             // Create new dimension vector:
04518             if( ( nd = _nd ) > 0 )
04519             {
04520                 d = new unsigned[ _nd ];
04521             }
04522         }
04523 
04524 #ifndef NDEBUG
04525         if( stat )
04526         {
04527             for( j = _nd; j--; )
04528             {
04529                 SIZE_CHECK( d[ j ] == _d[ j ] )
04530             }
04531         }
04532 #endif
04533 
04534         for( j = _nd, _ne = 1; j--; _ne *= ( d[ j ] = _d[ j ] ) );
04535         if( _nd == 0 )
04536         {
04537             _ne = 0;
04538         }
04539 
04540         if( ne != _ne )
04541         {
04542             SIZE_CHECK( ! stat )
04543             if( copy )
04544             {
04545                 T* _e = e;
04546                 if( _ne )
04547                 {
04548                     e = new T[ _ne ];
04549                 }
04550                 for( j = ne < _ne ? ne : _ne; j--; e[ j ] = _e[ j ] );
04551                 if( ne )
04552                 {
04553                     delete[ ] _e;
04554                 }
04555             }
04556             else
04557             {
04558                 if( ne )
04559                 {
04560                     delete[ ] e;
04561                 }
04562                 if( _ne )
04563                 {
04564                     e = new T[ _ne ];
04565                 }
04566             }
04567             ne = _ne;
04568         }
04569         eEnd = e + ne;
04570     }
04571 
04572     
04573    //=======================================================================
04600     Array( unsigned* _d, T* _e, unsigned _nd, unsigned _ne, bool _stat )
04601     {
04602         d    = _d;
04603         e    = _e;
04604         nd   = _nd;
04605         ne   = _ne;
04606         stat = _stat;
04607         eEnd = e + ne;
04608     }
04609 
04610 #ifndef __ARRAY_NO_GENERIC_IOSTREAM
04611     
04612     
04613    //=======================================================================
04664     void readFrom( std::istream& is )
04665     {
04666         const unsigned     MaxLen = 1024;
04667         char               s[ MaxLen ];
04668         char*              p;
04669         unsigned           i;
04670         std::vector< unsigned > idx; // dimension vector
04671 
04672         // Skip leading whitespaces
04673         is >> std::ws;
04674         is.getline( s, MaxLen );
04675 
04676         // Get end of type definition:
04677         p = strchr( s, '>' );
04678         // Go to begin of dimension sizes:
04679         if( p && *p ) p++;
04680         if( p && *p ) p++;
04681 
04682         // Get single dimension sizes, store them in vector
04683         // and resize current array:
04684         TYPE_CHECK( p && *p )
04685         if( p && *p )
04686         {
04687             do
04688             {
04689                 if( *p == ',' )
04690                 {
04691                     p++;
04692                 }
04693                 idx.push_back( unsigned( strtol( p, &p, 10 ) ) );
04694             }
04695             while( p && *p == ',' );
04696 
04697             TYPE_CHECK( p && *p == ')' )
04698 
04699             resize( idx );
04700 
04701             // Get elements of the array:
04702             for( i = 0; i < ne && is.good( ); i++ )
04703             {
04704                 is >> e[ i ];
04705             }
04706         }
04707 
04708         is >> std::ws;
04709     }
04710 
04711     
04712     
04713    //=======================================================================
04754     void writeTo( std::ostream& os ) const
04755     {
04756         unsigned i;
04757 
04758         os << "Array<" << typeid( T ).name( ) << ">(";
04759         for( i = 0; i < nd; i++ )
04760                 {
04761             if( i ) os << ',';
04762             os << d[ i ];
04763         }
04764         os << ")\n";
04765 
04766         for( i = 0; i < ne; i++ )
04767                 {
04768             if( i ) os << '\t';
04769             os << e[ i ];
04770         }
04771         os << std::endl;
04772     }
04773 #endif // !__ARRAY_NO_GENERIC_IOSTREAM
04774 };
04775 
04776 
04777 //===========================================================================
04794 template< class T >
04795 class ArrayReference : public Array< T >
04796 {
04797   public:
04798 
04799    //========================================================================
04816     ArrayReference( )
04817           : Array< T >( )
04818     {
04819         this->stat = true;
04820         this->d = NULL;
04821         this->e = NULL;
04822         this->nd = 0;
04823         this->ne = 0;
04824     }
04825 
04826     
04827    //========================================================================
04851     ArrayReference( unsigned* _d, T* _e, unsigned _nd, unsigned _ne )
04852           : Array< T >( )
04853     {
04854         this->d    = _d;
04855         this->e    = _e;
04856         this->nd   = _nd;
04857         this->ne   = _ne;
04858         this->stat = true;
04859         this->eEnd = this->e + this->ne;
04860     }
04861 
04862     
04863    //========================================================================
04883     ~ArrayReference( ) { }
04884 
04885     
04886     
04887    //========================================================================
04906     ArrayReference< T > operator = ( const T& v )
04907     {
04908         Array< T >::operator = ( v );
04909         return *this;
04910     }
04911 
04912     
04913     
04914    //========================================================================
04939     ArrayReference< T > operator = ( const std::vector< T >& v )
04940     {
04941         Array< T >::operator = ( v );
04942         return *this;
04943     }
04944 
04945     
04946     
04947    //========================================================================
04972     ArrayReference< T > operator = ( const Array< T >& v )
04973     {
04974         Array< T >::operator = ( v );
04975         return *this;
04976     }
04977 
04978 
04979    //========================================================================
04997     ArrayReference< T > copyReference( Array< T >& v )
04998     {
04999         this->d    = v.d;
05000         this->e    = v.e;
05001         this->nd   = v.nd;
05002         this->ne   = v.ne;
05003         this->stat = true;
05004         this->eEnd = this->e + this->ne;
05005         return *this;
05006     }
05007 
05008    //========================================================================
05027     ArrayReference< T > copyReference( ArrayReference< T > v )
05028     {
05029         this->d    = v.d;
05030         this->e    = v.e;
05031         this->nd   = v.nd;
05032         this->ne   = v.ne;
05033         this->stat = true;
05034         this->eEnd = this->e + this->ne;
05035         return *this;
05036     }
05037 };
05038 
05039 //========================================================================
05079 template< class T >
05080 inline ArrayReference< T > Array< T >::operator [ ] ( unsigned i )
05081 {
05082     SIZE_CHECK( nd > 0 )
05083     RANGE_CHECK( i < d[ 0 ] )
05084     return ArrayReference< T >( d+1, e+i*(ne/d[ 0 ]), nd-1, ne/d[ 0 ] );
05085 }
05086 
05087 
05088 //========================================================================
05128 template< class T >
05129 inline const ArrayReference< T > Array< T >::operator [ ] ( unsigned i ) const
05130 {
05131     SIZE_CHECK( nd > 0 )
05132     RANGE_CHECK( i < d[ 0 ] )
05133     return ArrayReference< T >( d+1, e+i*(ne/d[ 0 ]), nd-1, ne/d[ 0 ] );
05134 }

05137 #endif //__ARRAY_H
